content.text: A customer buys \(3\mathrm{kg}\) of mushrooms at \(\$ 1.04\) per kg and \(4\mathrm{kg}\) of carrots at \(\$ 1.28\) per kg
Work out the mass of mushrooms sold as a percentage of the total mass
The total mass of potatoes, mushrooms and carrots sold is \(1500\mathrm{kg}\)
Find the mass of carrots the grocer sells this week
The profit the grocer makes selling \(1\mathrm{kg}\) of carrots is \(\$ 0.75\)
Find the total profit the grocer makes selling carrots this week
On the last day of the week, the grocer reduces the price of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) of potatoes by \(8\%\) to \(\$ 1.15\)
Calculate the original price of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) of potatoes
In one week, the ratio of the masses of vegetables sold by the grocer is
The grocer buys \(620\mathrm{kg}\) of onions, correct to the nearest \(20\mathrm{kg}\)
He packs them into bags each containing \(5\mathrm{kg}\) of onions, correct to the nearest \(1\mathrm{kg}\)
Calculate the upper bound for the number of bags of onions that he packs
A grocer sells potatoes, mushrooms and carrots
Give a geometrical reason for each statement you make
Show that triangle \(ABX\) is similar to triangle \(CDX\)
The ratio area of triangle \(ABX\) : area of triangle \(CDX\) = .............. : 1
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on a circle
The table shows information about the marks gained by each of 10 students in a test
Paulo's mean mark for 7 homework tasks is 17
After completing the 8th task, his mean mark is 17.5
Calculate Paulo's mark for the 8th task
The table shows the percentage scored by each of 100 students in their final exam
On the grid, draw a histogram to show this information
Calculate the volume of the pyramid
[The volume, \(V,\) of a pyramid with base area \(A\) and height \(h\) is \(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\) .]
Calculate the total surface area of the pyramid
The diagram shows a pyramid with a square base \(BCDE\)
The diagonals \(CE\) and \(BD\) intersect at \(M,\) and the vertex \(F\) is directly above \(M.\)
The diagram shows a toy made from a cone and a hemisphere
The base radius of the cone and the radius of the hemisphere are both \(r\mathrm{cm}\)
The slant height of the cone is \(3r\mathrm{cm}\)
The total surface area of the toy is \(304\mathrm{cm}^2\)
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\).]
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(A = 4\pi r^2\).]
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form
You must show all your working
Calculate the shortest distance from \(A\) to \(BC\)
On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y = 4 - 3x\)
On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y = -x^{2}\)
Find the coordinates of the turning points of the graph of \(y = 10 + 9x^{2} - 2x^{3}\)
You must show all your working
Determine whether each turning point is a maximum or a minimum
Janna invests in an account that pays simple interest at a rate of \(r \%\) per year
Kamal invests in an account that pays compound interest at a rate of \(R\%\) per year
At the end of 12 years, they each have \(\$ 12 800.\)
The population of a city is growing exponentially at a rate of \(1.8\%\) per year
Find the number of complete years from now when the population will first be more than 300 000
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = 2x^{3} + 6x^{2} - 2.5\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\)
By drawing a suitable line on the graph, solve the equation \(2x^{3} + 6x^{2} = 4.5\)
The equation \(2x^{3} + 6x^{2} - 2.5 = k\) has exactly two solutions
Write down the two possible values of \(k\)
The table shows some values for \(y = 2x^{3} + 6x^{2} - 2.5\)

LaTeX superscript (^) found outside math mode

content.text: The diagram shows a circle of radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\), with a sector removed
Calculate the perimeter of the remaining shaded shape
The diagram in **part(a)** shows the top of a cylindrical cake with a slice removed
The volume of cake that remains is \(3510 \mathrm{cm}^3\)
Calculate the height of the cake
